COVID-19





















 

LATEST UPDATES

More Announcements














March 20, 2023: Changes to COVID-19 protocols
February 23, 2023: End of On-Site COVID-19 PCR Testing
December 14, 2022: UC Riverside 2022-23 flu vaccination program
November 15, 2022: Public health reminders for the holiday season




October 20, 2022: "Compassionate clause" concluding at the end of this quarter
October 5, 2022: COVID-19 fall update
September 16, 2022: New COVID-19 booster shots available
September 8, 2022: Student update on COVID-19 booster requirement



















 

WHAT TO EXPECT


 


Prioritizing Health and Safety
The safety and well-being of our students, employees, and visitors remains a top priority.

KEEP HIGHLANDERS HEALTHY









 

Face Coverings
Indoor masking strongly recommended.
Mask Up


 

Screening Check
Fill out the Screening Check when symptomatic, positive, or exposed.
COMPLETe the Check


 

Testing
Free testing options on and off campus.
Get Tested


 

Vaccines
Booster required for students and employees.

COVID-19 NEWS














September 19, 2022


      COVID-19 took serious toll on Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander mental and physical health
    

      

  


  Two UC Riverside-led studies found concerning psychological and physical health problems among more than 300 NH/PIs in five US states
    

Read More »









September 07, 2022


      A shot in the arm
    

      

  


  UC Riverside experts answer questions on Americans needing just one COVID-19 booster vaccine each year
    

Read More »









July 05, 2022


      Upward ventilation offers better protection from indoor coronavirus transmission
    

      

  


  A simple change in the direction of the air forced through indoor gathering spaces by heating, air conditioning, and ventilation systems, could reduce the spread of infectious diseases like COVID-19.
    

Read More »
